title.rendered: Commercial Refrigeration Equipment Market in United States is Projected to Rise at a CAGR of 3.90% through 2034

content.rendered:
Variable Speed Compressors Shape the United States Commercial Refrigeration Equipment Industry, Enhancing Control, Efficiency, and Performance. The Industry is Forecasted to Surpass US$ 11,801.44 million through 2034.

NEWARK, Del, July 26, 2024 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) — The United States commercial refrigeration equipment industry is anticipated to expand at a CAGR of 3.90% through 2034. The industry is estimated to reach USD 8,049.70 million in 2024 and is projected to reach a valuation of USD 11,801.44 million by 2034. There is increasing demand from the food distribution sector, which holds a substantial industry share.

The rising need for efficient and reliable refrigeration solutions to support food distribution networks nationwide is a significant driver. Additionally, the booming food service industry, particularly the restaurant segment, fuels the demand for specialized refrigeration equipment, contributing to the industry’s upward trajectory.

Energy consumption remains a critical concern, with traditional refrigeration systems often characterized by high energy usage. This poses challenges in meeting sustainability goals and complying with environmental regulations. The initial capital investment required for advanced, energy-efficient systems restrains smaller businesses. This impacts the adoption rate and hinders the expansion of the United States commercial refrigeration equipment industry.

Request a Report Sample to Gain Comprehensive Insights! https://www.futuremarketinsights.com/reports/sample/rep-us-1305

Amidst challenges, ample opportunities emerge for industry players to capitalize on. The ongoing trend toward sustainable and eco-friendly solutions presents a notable opportunity. Manufacturers focusing on customization and modular solutions tailored to specific business needs can tap into an industry segment seeking flexibility and adaptability.

The adoption of smart refrigeration technologies, including IoT-enabled monitoring and control systems, is gaining traction. This allows businesses to optimize energy usage, ensure food safety, and remotely manage equipment. Another prominent trend is the increasing demand for eco-friendly refrigerants that align with environmental sustainability goals. Moreover, there is a noticeable shift toward modular and scalable refrigeration solutions, providing businesses with adaptable options to accommodate evolving requirements.

Key Takeaways from the United States Commercial Refrigeration Equipment Industry

  • The commercial refrigeration equipment industry in the Northeast United States is anticipated to experience a CAGR of 6.2% until 2034.
  • In the Midwest United States, the industry is positioned for a consistent CAGR of 6.1% through 2034.
  • The commercial refrigeration equipment sector in the West United States is projected to observe a CAGR of 5.8% by 2034.
  • The South United States is expected to maintain a stable CAGR of 5.7% in the commercial refrigeration equipment industry until 2034.
  • Regarding product type, the transportation refrigerators category dominates with a 30.50% share in 2024.
  • Considering application, the food services segment is set to hold a significant 27.80% share in 2024.

“Companies investing in the development of energy-efficient refrigeration equipment stand to gain a competitive edge. Moreover, the growing emphasis on smart technologies and IoT integration in commercial refrigeration opens avenues for innovation”, says a Nikhil Kaitwade (Associate Vice President at Future Market Insights, Inc.)

Competitive Landscape of the United States Commercial Refrigeration Equipment Industry

The United States commercial refrigeration equipment industry is characterized by intense competition driven by a combination of established industry players and emerging innovators. Key companies, such as Carrier Global Corporation, Emerson Electric Co., and Hussmann Corporation, continue to dominate the industry with their extensive product portfolios and established distribution networks. These industry giants leverage their longstanding presence to offer various refrigeration solutions, catering to diverse needs across sectors such as retail, food service, and healthcare.

As technological advancements become a focal point in the industry, newer entrants and innovative startups are gaining traction. The industry is witnessing a surge in companies specializing in smart and energy-efficient refrigeration solutions, responding to the increasing demand for sustainable practices and cost-effective operations. Startups like Phononic and companies specializing in IoT-enabled refrigeration, such as RIoT Technologies, are introducing disruptive technologies that redefine how businesses approach their refrigeration needs. This fosters healthy competition and encourages continuous innovation, pushing the industry toward more environmentally friendly and efficient solutions.

Key Factors Shaping the Demand Outlook of the Commercial Refrigeration Equipment Industry

•        The growing demand for packaged and frozen goods has significantly increased owing to the changing people’s lifestyles and eating habits.

•        The market for commercial refrigeration equipment is driven by the requirement for commercial refrigeration systems, which grows together with the demand for these products.

•        Rising popularity of frozen food products and ready-to-drink beverages, which in turn is driving the commercial refrigeration equipment market.

•        Growing advances in technology are expected to create new growth prospects for commercial refrigeration equipment manufacturers.

Commercial Refrigerators & Industrial Refrigerators to Account for Majority of Sales Revenue

Refrigerators are basic units of any refrigeration equipment and this is what majorly drives their sales. Increasing international food trade has spawned demand for commercial refrigerators that are transport-friendly to facilitate the transport of refrigerated products across the world. Increasing advancements in multiple industries have also propelled shipments of industrial refrigerators and industrial freezers.

Recent Developments in the United States Commercial Refrigeration Equipment Industry

Carrier Corporation has introduced a new product line called Carrier Transicold Vector 8611MT. This multi-temperature trailer refrigeration unit can provide effective cooling and heating performance for trailers with numerous compartments.

Dover Corporation acquired Kelvion Refrigeration GmbH, a German manufacturer of heat exchangers, condensers, and evaporators for commercial refrigeration applications.

Johnson Controls International plc has launched a new product called Johnson Controls Metasys 11.0, a building automation system that can integrate and operate various devices and systems, including HVAC, lighting, security, and refrigeration.

Key Companies Providing Commercial Refrigeration Equipment in the United States

  • Carrier Corporation
  • Dover Corporation
  • Hussmann Corporation
  • Johnson Controls International plc
  • Emerson Electric Co.
  • United Technologies Corporation
  • Manitowoc Company, Inc.
  • True Manufacturing Company

Get in Touch with Our Sales Team to Secure Your Copy of the Report Now! https://www.futuremarketinsights.com/checkout/1305

Key Segments

By Product Type:

  • Refrigerated Display Cases
  • Beverage Refrigeration Equipment
  • Drinking Fountain
  • Soda Fountain
  • Beverage Dispensing Equipment
  • Beer Dispensing Equipment
  • Transportation Refrigeration Systems

By Application:

  • Food Services
  • Restaurants
  • Convenience Stores
  • Food Retail
  • Food and Beverage Production
  • Logistics and Transportation
  • Food and Beverage Distribution

By Region:

  • Northeast United States
  • Midwest United States
  • West United States
  • South United States

Authored By

Nikhil Kaitwade (Associate Vice President at Future Market Insights, Inc.) has over a decade of experience in market research and business consulting. He has successfully delivered 1500+ client assignments, predominantly in Automotive, Chemicals, Industrial Equipment, Oil & Gas, and Service industries.

His core competency circles around developing research methodology, creating a unique analysis framework, statistical data models for pricing analysis, competition mapping, and market feasibility analysis. His expertise also extends wide and beyond analysis, advising clients on identifying growth potential in established and niche market segments, investment/divestment decisions, and market entry decision-making.

Nikhil holds an MBA degree in Marketing and IT and a Graduate in Mechanical Engineering. Nikhil has authored several publications and quoted in journals like EMS Now, EPR Magazine, and EE Times.

Have a Look at Related Research Reports of Industrial Automation Domain

The refrigeration leak detector market is registering a valuation of US$ 106.8 million in 2023. The market is rising to US$ 149.3 million by 2033. The market is securing a CAGR of 3.4% during the forecast period.

The refrigeration and air conditioning compressors market is estimated to secure a CAGR of 3% during the forecast period. The market registered a valuation of US$ 35.1 billion in 2023 and reached US$ 47.2 billion by 2033.

The global refrigeration compressor market size is expected to grow from US$ 37,597.8 Million in 2022 to US$ 53,732.1 Million by 2032, with overall sales exhibiting a CAGR of 3.6% throughout the forecast period (2022 to 2032).

The global demand for refrigeration coolers is expected to have a moderate CAGR of 5.6% during the forecast period. The overall refrigeration coolers market is projected to reach a valuation of US$ 6,409.7 million by 2033.

The global commercial refrigeration compressors market size is set to reach US$ 38,687.2 million in 2023. Overall sales of commercial refrigeration compressors are likely to surge at 4.3% CAGR, taking the forecasted market valuation to US$ 58,940.03 million by the end of 2033.

The Commercial refrigeration system market are projected to grow steadily, reaching USD 54.8 billion in 2024. The market is expected to reach USD 87.6 billion by 2034, representing a CAGR of 4.8%.

The Sales of mining equipment in Latin America are estimated to be valued at US$ 6,846 million in 2024 amid their growing usage in the construction sector. The industry is projected to surge at a CAGR of 4.7% throughout the forecast period. By 2034, the industry size is set to reach US$ 10,836.9 million.

The valuation of the total sales of compact construction equipment in the year 2023 is estimated to be US$ 224.1 billion. The global compact construction equipment market is expected to register a CAGR of 3.8% from 2023 to 2033. Based on the compact construction equipment market analysis report by FMI, it can reach US$ 325.4 billion by 2033.

The North America commercial refrigeration equipment industry size is projected to surpass a valuation of US$ 24,118.8 million by 2033. As per the analysis, the industry of commercial refrigeration equipment in North America is likely to record a CAGR of 4.1% through 2033, with a current valuation of US$ 16,072.9 million in 2023.

The refrigerated display case market size expects a significant bump in its value, from US$ 10,034.30 million in 2024 to US$ 17,633.71 million by 2034. The updated report points to a CAGR of 5.80% CAGR from 2024 to 2034. That is a noteworthy improvement from the previous CAGR of 1.73% observed between 2019 and 2023.

About Future Market Insights (FMI)

Future Market Insights, Inc. (ESOMAR certified, recipient of the Stevie Award, and a member of the Greater New York Chamber of Commerce) offers profound insights into the driving factors that are boosting demand in the market. FMI stands as the leading global provider of market intelligence, advisory services, consulting, and events for the Packaging, Food and Beverage, Consumer Technology, Healthcare, Industrial, and Chemicals markets. With a vast team of ~400 analysts worldwide, FMI provides global, regional, and local expertise on diverse domains and industry trends across more than 110 countries.
